p.span: Recognized by KIPLINGER MAGAZINE as the Eighth-best city to raise kids and listed in GETTINGSMART.COM as No. 5 in must-visit districts.

div.div: Posted by Kevin Witt on 2/25/2020 11:30:00 AM

span.a: Visit the 2020 United States Census website
See the City of Middletown's Census information postcard

h2.span: The 2020 Census counts every person living in the 50 states, District of Columbia, and five U.S. territories. The count is mandated by the Constitution and conducted by the U.S. Census Bureau, a nonpartisan government agency. The 2020 Census counts the population in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, and five U.S. territories (Puerto Rico, American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the U.S. Virgin Islands). Each home will receive an invitation to respond to a short questionnaire—online, by phone, or by mail.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Participate in the 2020 U.S. Census

h1.span: 2020-21 budget vote and school board election

span.strong: 2020-21 BUDGET VOTE AND BOARD OF EDUCATION ELECTION

p.span: When: TO BE ANNOUNCED, 7 a.m.-9 p.m. Voting sites include Middletown High School, Presidential Park Elementary School and Maple Hill Annex at Truman Moon. If you are unsure where you vote, please contact District Clerk Taryn Clark at (845) 326-1196. SEE WHERE YOU VOTE
Click here for budget presentations and information.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for 2020-21 budget vote and school board election
